intro: Cyrtandra limahuliensis, commonly known as the Limahuli Cyrtandra, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of Kauai in Hawaii. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests and along stream banks. It is known for its delicate, lance-shaped leaves and is considered endangered due to habitat loss and invasive species. Conservation efforts are ongoing to protect and propagate this unique Hawaiian endemic species.
